snippet: Focusing too much on disclosure itself can blind investors to more important issues and hurt returns.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column; focusing too much on disclosure in matters of money management can blind investors to more important issues and hurt returns; in many ways, trust in financial advisers supersedes disclosure; investors should be more involved in their investments to avoid problems that may arise with or without conflict of interest disclosures.
lead_paragraph: Focusing too much on disclosure itself can blind investors to more important issues and hurt returns.

headline.print_headline: In Investing, Disclosure Only Gets You So Far
headline.main: In Investing, Disclosure Only Gets You So Far
